domainList.title: Activity Monitor
domainList.descriptionMarkdown:
Activity Monitor is the built-in utility for monitoring your systems resource usage, such as
CPU, RAM, Disk, Network, and Energy.

keyList.title: Dock Icon type
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose what information should be shown in the app's Dock icon, if any.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: int
  * 0
  * 2
  * 3
  * 5
  * 6

demoList.title: Set to 0 (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Just show the App's regular icon.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "0" && killall Activity\ Monitor
```
demoList.shell: defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "0" && killall Activity\ Monitor

demoList.title: Set to 2
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show Network usage over time, as two mirrored line graphs.
The top (blue) chart shows down-stream traffic.
The bottom (red) chart shows up-stream traffic.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "2" && killall Activity\ Monitor
```
demoList.shell: defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "2" && killall Activity\ Monitor

demoList.title: Set to 3
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show Disk usage over time, as two mirrored line graphs.
The top (blue) chart shows disk read traffic.
The bottom (red) chart shows disk write traffic.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "3" && killall Activity\ Monitor
```
demoList.shell: defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "3" && killall Activity\ Monitor

demoList.title: Set to 5
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show the current CPU usages, as a verticle meter.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "5" && killall Activity\ Monitor
```
demoList.shell: defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "5" && killall Activity\ Monitor

demoList.title: Set to 6
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show CPU usage history, graphed over time.
If your device has 4 threads or less, it'll show one graph per thread, all stacked vertically.
If you have more than 4 threads, then only one bar graph will be shown, for the total CPU usage.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "6" && killall Activity\ Monitor
```
demoList.shell: defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" -int "6" && killall Activity\ Monitor

demoList.title: Reset to default value
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
```bash
defaults delete com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" && killall Activity\ Monitor
```
demoList.shell: defaults delete com.apple.ActivityMonitor "IconType" && killall Activity\ Monitor

keyList.title: Update Frequency
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
How frequently Activity Monitor should update its data, in seconds.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: int
  * 1
  * 2
  * 5

demoList.title: Set to 1
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Very often (1s)

```bash
defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "UpdatePeriod" -int "1" && killall Activity\ Monitor
```
demoList.shell: defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "UpdatePeriod" -int "1" && killall Activity\ Monitor

demoList.title: Set to 2
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Often (2s)

```bash
defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "UpdatePeriod" -int "2" && killall Activity\ Monitor
```
demoList.shell: defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "UpdatePeriod" -int "2" && killall Activity\ Monitor

demoList.title: Set to 5 (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Normally (5s)

```bash
defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "UpdatePeriod" -int "5" && killall Activity\ Monitor
```
demoList.shell: defaults write com.apple.ActivityMonitor "UpdatePeriod" -int "5" && killall Activity\ Monitor

demoList.title: Reset to default value
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
```bash
defaults delete com.apple.ActivityMonitor "UpdatePeriod" && killall Activity\ Monitor
```
demoList.shell: defaults delete com.apple.ActivityMonitor "UpdatePeriod" && killall Activity\ Monitor

domainList.title: Desktop
domainList.descriptionMarkdown:
Desktop shows files and icons on a background, works as a part of the Finder.
The desktop view can be customized.

keyList.title: Keep folders on top
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Keep folders on top when sorting

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Keep folders on top

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "_FXSortFoldersFirstOnDesktop" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Don't keep folders on top

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "_FXSortFoldersFirstOnDesktop" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: All icons
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide all icons on desktop

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide all icons

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "CreateDesktop" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show all icons

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "CreateDesktop" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: External disks
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide external disks on desktop

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide external disks

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowExternalHardDrivesOnDesktop" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show external disks

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowExternalHardDrivesOnDesktop" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Disks
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show hard disks on desktop

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show hard disks

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowHardDrivesOnDesktop" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide hard disks

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowHardDrivesOnDesktop" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Connected servers
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show connected servers on desktop

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show connected servers

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowMountedServersOnDesktop" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide connected servers

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowMountedServersOnDesktop" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Removable media
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide removable media *(CDs, DVDs and iPods)* on desktop

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide removable media

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowRemovableMediaOnDesktop" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show removable media

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowRemovableMediaOnDesktop" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

domainList.title: Dock
domainList.descriptionMarkdown:
The Dock is a prominent feature of macOS.
It is used to launch applications and to switch between running applications.
By default you can find it on the bottom of your screen.

You can customize it as you like.

keyList.title: Autohide delay
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Change the Dock opening delay.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: float

demoList.title: Set to 0.2 (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
By default, the Dock only opens if the mouse doesn't move for 0.2 seconds

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "autohide-delay" -float "0.2" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to 0
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Remove the autohide delay, the Dock appears instantly

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "autohide-delay" -float "0" && killall Dock
```

keyList.title: Autohide animation time
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Change the Dock opening and closing animation times.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: float

demoList.title: Set to 0.5 (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
By default, the Dock opening and closing animations take 0.5 seconds

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "autohide-time-modifier" -float "0.5" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to 2
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Increase the Dock animation time

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "autohide-time-modifier" -float "2" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to 0
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Remove the Dock autohide animation

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "autohide-time-modifier" -float "0" && killall Dock
```

keyList.title: Autohide
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Autohides the Dock. You can toggle the Dock using `⌥ alt`+`⌘ cmd`+`d`.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Always display the Dock

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "autohide" -bool "false" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Autohide the Dock when the mouse is out

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "autohide" -bool "true" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Dock settings from macOS UI
2. Toggle "Automatically hide and show the Dock" value

keyList.title: Minimize animation effect
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Change the Dock minimize animation.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: string
  * genie
  * scale
  * suck

demoList.title: Set to suck
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Suck is an secret value you can't find inside the System Preferences

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "mineffect" -string "suck" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Dock settings from macOS UI
2. Set "Minimise window using" dropdown value

keyList.title: Position
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Set the Dock position

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: string
  * left
  * bottom
  * right

demoList.title: Set to left
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Put the Dock on the left of the screen

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "orientation" -string "left" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to bottom (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Put the Dock on the bottom of the screen

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "orientation" -string "bottom" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to right
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Put the Dock on the right of the screen

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "orientation" -string "right" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Dock settings from macOS UI
2. Set "Position on the screen" dropdown value

keyList.title: Scroll to Exposé app
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Scroll up on a Dock icon to show all Space's opened windows for an app, or open stack.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Enable

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "scroll-to-open" -bool "true" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Disable

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "scroll-to-open" -bool "false" && killall Dock
```

keyList.title: Show recents
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show recently used apps in a separate section of the Dock.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Display recent apps in the Dock

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "show-recents" -bool "true" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do not display recent apps in the Dock

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "show-recents" -bool "false" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Dock settings from macOS UI
2. Set "Show recent applications in Dock" dropdown value

keyList.title: Active applications only
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Only show opened apps in Dock.

⚠️ Beware this command empties your Dock.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Only show active apps

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "static-only" -bool "true" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show apps pinned to the dock

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "static-only" -bool "false" && killall Dock
```

keyList.title: Change macOS Dock icon size
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Set the icon size of Dock items in pixels.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: int

demoList.title: Set to 36
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Dock icon size of 36 pixels.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "tilesize" -int "36" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to 48 (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Dock icon size of 48 pixels.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "tilesize" -int "48" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Dock settings from macOS UI
2. Slide "Size" range value

domainList.title: Feedback Assistant
domainList.descriptionMarkdown: The Feedback Assistant app allows user to submit reports for developer or public betas.

keyList.title: Autogather
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose whether to autogather large files when submitting a feedback report.

Can result in a slow Mac and important upload metrics.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Feedback Assistant gathers large files when submitting a report

```bash
defaults write com.apple.appleseed.FeedbackAssistant "Autogather" -bool "true"
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do not autogather large files when submitting a report

```bash
defaults write com.apple.appleseed.FeedbackAssistant "Autogather" -bool "false"
```

domainList.title: Finder
domainList.descriptionMarkdown:
The Finder is the default file manager on macOS.
It is responsible for the launching of other applications,
and for the overall user management of files, disks, and network volumes.
In a tradition dating back to the Classic Mac OS of the 1980s and 1990s,
the Finder icon is the smiling screen of a computer, known as the Happy Mac logo.

Some of its features can be customized.

keyList.title: Keep folders on top
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Keep folders on top when sorting by name

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Keep folders on top

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "_FXSortFoldersFirst" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do not keep folders on top

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "_FXSortFoldersFirst" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Show extensions
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show all file extensions in the Finder.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do not show all file extensions inside the Finder

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "AppleShowAllExtensions" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show all file extensions inside the Finder

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "AppleShowAllExtensions" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Show hidden files
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show hidden files in the Finder. You can toggle the value using `⌘ cmd`+`⇧ shift`+`.`.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do not show hidden files inside the Finder

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "AppleShowAllFiles" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show hidden files inside the Finder

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "AppleShowAllFiles" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Default search scope
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Set the default search scope when performing a search

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: string

demoList.title: Set to SCcf
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Search the current folder

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "FXDefaultSearchScope" -string "SCcf" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to SCsp
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Use the previous search scope

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "FXDefaultSearchScope" -string "SCsp" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to SCev (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Search this Mac

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "FXDefaultSearchScope" -string "SCev" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Changing file extension warning
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose whether to display a warning when changing a file extension.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Display a warning when changing a file extension in the Finder

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "FXEnableExtensionChangeWarning" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do not display the warning

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "FXEnableExtensionChangeWarning" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Set the default view style for folders without custom setting

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: string

demoList.title: Set to clmv
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Column view

```bash

```

demoList.title: Set to Nlsv
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
List view

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "FXPreferredViewStyle" -string "Nlsv" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to glyv
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Gallery View

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "FXPreferredViewStyle" -string "glyv" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to icnv (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Icon view

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "FXPreferredViewStyle" -string "icnv" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Empty bin items after 30 days
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Remove items in the bin after 30 days

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Automatically empty bin after 30 days

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "FXRemoveOldTrashItems" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Keep bin as is

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "FXRemoveOldTrashItems" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Save to disk or iCloud by default
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose whether the default file save location is on disk or iCloud

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
iCloud Documents is the default directory opened in the fileviewer dialog when saving a new document

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSDocumentSaveNewDocumentsToCloud" -bool "true"
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
home directory is opened in the fileviewer dialog when saving a new document

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSDocumentSaveNewDocumentsToCloud" -bool "false"
```

keyList.title: Set sidebar icon size
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose the size of Finder sidebar icons

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: int

demoList.title: Set to 1
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Small


demoList.title: Set to 2 (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Medium

```bash

```

demoList.title: Set to 3
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Large

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSTableViewDefaultSizeMode" -int "3" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Adjust toolbar title rollover delay
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose the delay of the auto-hidden document-proxy icon.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: float

demoList.title: Set to 0.5 (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
By default, the toolbar title hovering delay takes 0.5 seconds

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSToolbarTitleViewRolloverDelay" -float "0.5" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to 0
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Remove the delay when hovering the toolbar title

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSToolbarTitleViewRolloverDelay" -float "0" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to 1
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Increase the delay when hovering the toolbar title

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSToolbarTitleViewRolloverDelay" -float "1" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Quit
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Add a quit option to the Finder. Behaves strangely when activated, would not recommend.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide the Finder "Quit" option

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "QuitMenuItem" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Display the Finder "Quit" option

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "QuitMenuItem" -bool "true" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Path bar
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show path bar in the bottom of the Finder windows

  * Ventura

  * Big Sur

demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show path bar

```bash

```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide path bar

```bash
defaults write com.apple.finder "ShowPathbar" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

keyList.title: Title bar icons
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Always show folder icon before title in the title bar

⚠️ This command requires to grant full disk access to the terminal
(System Preferences → Security & Privacy → Full Disk Access)

  * Ventura
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show icon in the title bar

```bash

```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide icon from the title bar

```bash
defaults write com.apple.universalaccess "showWindowTitlebarIcons" -bool "false" && killall Finder
```

domainList.title: Keyboard
domainList.descriptionMarkdown: The hardware device to type on a computer.

keyList.title: Function key usage
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose what happens when you press the Fn or 🌐︎ key on the keyboard.

⚠️ A restart of your Mac is required to apply these changes.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
* **Parameter type**: int
  * 0
  * 1
  * 2
  * 3

demoList.title: Set to: Do Nothing (default)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Nothing happens.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.HIToolbox AppleFnUsageType -int "0"
```

demoList.title: Set to: Change input source
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Switches between keyboard layouts for writing in other languages (known as input sources).

```bash
defaults write com.apple.HIToolbox AppleFnUsageType -int "1"
```

demoList.title: Set to: Show Emoji & Symbols
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Opens the Character Viewer for entering emoji, symbols, and more.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.HIToolbox AppleFnUsageType -int "2"
```

demoList.title: Set to: Start Dictation
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Starts dictation when you press the key twice (you may be asked to enable dictation first).

```bash
defaults write com.apple.HIToolbox AppleFnUsageType -int "3"
```

keyList.title: Function keys behavior
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Allows you to change the behavior of the function keys. The two possible options are:

* Use `F1`, `F2`, etc. as special keys (default)
* Use `F1`, `F2`, etc. as standard function keys

⚠️ A restart of your Mac is required to apply these changes.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
By default, pressing a function key will perform the special feature printed on that key.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain com.apple.keyboard.fnState -bool false
```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
`F1`, `F2`, etc. behave as standard function keys. Press the `fn` key to use the special features printed on the key.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain com.apple.keyboard.fnState -bool true
```

keyList.title: Key held down behavior
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Allows you to select the behavior when a key is held down for a long time. The two possible behaviors are:

* show character accents menu (default)
* repeat character while key held

⚠️ Restarting the Mac, closing the session or restarting the application is necessary to take into effect the changes.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
By default, when a key is held down, the accents menu is displayed.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "ApplePressAndHoldEnabled" -bool "true"
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Repeats the key as long as it is held down.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "ApplePressAndHoldEnabled" -bool "false"
```

domainList.title: Menu Bar
domainList.descriptionMarkdown: The menu bar runs along the top of the screen on your Mac. Use the menus and icons in the menu bar to choose commands, perform tasks, and check status.

keyList.title: Set menubar digital clock format
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
This setting configures the time and date format for the menubar digital clock.
Accepted values depend on your Language & Region settings.

* `ss` for seconds.
* `HH` for 24-hour clock.
* `EEE` for 3-letter day of the week.
* `d MMM` for day of the month and 3-letter month.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: string

demoList.title: Set to "EEE d MMM HH:mm:ss"
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Thu 18 Aug 21:46:18

```bash
defaults write com.apple.menuextra.clock "DateFormat" -string "\"EEE d MMM HH:mm:ss\""
```
demoList.shell: defaults write com.apple.menuextra.clock "DateFormat" -string "\"EEE d MMM HH:mm:ss\""

keyList.title: Flash clock time separators
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
When enabled, the clock indicator (which by default is the colon) will flash on and off each second.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
The time separator stays solid continuously.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.menuextra.clock "FlashDateSeparators" -bool "false" && killall SystemUIServer
```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
The time separator flashes every second.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.menuextra.clock "FlashDateSeparators" -bool "true" && killall SystemUIServer
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Clock settings from macOS UI
2. Toggle "Flash the time separator" value

domainList.title: Messages
domainList.descriptionMarkdown:
Messages serves as a comprehensive messaging platform in macOS, allowing users to send and receive iMessages, photos, videos, and audio messages seamlessly across Apple devices.
When connected with an iPhone, users can send and receive SMS and MMS messages directly from their Mac.

keyList.title: Show Subject Field
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show the subject field which appears above the iMessage/Text Message field in Messages. Text entered in the subject field will be sent in bold (unless there is no text in the iMessage/Text Message field; in this case, the text in the subject field will be sent without the bold effect).

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show the subject field in Messages

```bash
defaults write com.apple.MobileSMS "MMSShowSubject" -bool "true" && killall Messages
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Hide the subject field in Messages

```bash
defaults write com.apple.MobileSMS "MMSShowSubject" -bool "false" && killall Messages
```

domainList.title: Miscellaneous
domainList.descriptionMarkdown: All the others `defaults` that don't deserve their own category.

keyList.title: Help Menu position
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose whether the Help Menu should be always-on-top.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
By default, the Help Menu is always-on-top

```bash
defaults write com.apple.helpviewer "DevMode" -bool "false"
```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
The Help Menu can go behind other windows

```bash
defaults write com.apple.helpviewer "DevMode" -bool "true"
```

keyList.title: Enable spring loading for all Dock items
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Drag a file over an icon in the Dock, hover, and the application will open. The behaviour is unchanged if the app is already open. This behaviour has been observed with Preview, Quicktime, and iWork (Keynote, Pages, Numbers).

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Spring loading is disabled for Dock items.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "enable-spring-load-actions-on-all-items" -bool "false" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Spring loading is enabled for Dock items.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "enable-spring-load-actions-on-all-items" -bool "true" && killall Dock
```

keyList.title: Disable application quarantine message
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Turn off the “Application Downloaded from Internet” quarantine warning.

⚠️ Stopped working on Big Sur.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
"Application Downloaded from Internet" popup will display

```bash
defaults write com.apple.LaunchServices "LSQuarantine" -bool "true"
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
"Application Downloaded from Internet" popup will not display

```bash
defaults write com.apple.LaunchServices "LSQuarantine" -bool "false"
```

keyList.title: Close confirm changes popup
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Should you be asked to keep changes when closing documents or just have changes saved automatically.
Requires closing and opening the app before working. Tested on Apple Preview.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Auto saving is enabled, you are not prompted to save changes.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSCloseAlwaysConfirmsChanges" -bool "true"
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Auto saving is disabled, you are prompted if you want to save changes.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "NSCloseAlwaysConfirmsChanges" -bool "false"
```

keyList.title: Show Music song notifications
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Display a notification when a new song starts in the Music app.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Notifications will not be displayed.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.Music "userWantsPlaybackNotifications" -bool "false" && killall Music
```

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Notifications will be displayed.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.Music "userWantsPlaybackNotifications" -bool "true" && killall Music
```

domainList.title: Mission Control
domainList.descriptionMarkdown:
Formerly known as Spaces, Mission Control allows a user to do the following:

* `⌃ ctrl`+`↑ up` view all open application windows.
* `⌃ ctrl`+`↓ down` view all open application windows of a specific application.
* `⌘ cmd`+`F3 Mission Control` hide all application windows and show the desktop.
* `⌃ ctrl`+`← left`/`→ right` manage application windows across multiple virtual desktops.
* manage application windows across multiple monitors.

keyList.title: Switch to Space with open windows
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
When switching to an app, switch to a space with open windows for this app.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Switch to a Space with open windows for the application.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "AppleSpacesSwitchOnActivate" -bool "true" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do not switch to a Space with open windows for the application.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain "AppleSpacesSwitchOnActivate" -bool "false" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Dock settings from macOS UI
2. Toggle "When switching to an application, switch to a Space with open windows for the application" value

keyList.title: Group windows by application
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
If you have several windows from multiple apps open simultaneously, have the windows organised by app in
Mission Control.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Group windows by application.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "expose-group-apps" -bool "true" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do not group windows by application.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "expose-group-apps" -bool "false" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Dock settings from macOS UI
2. Toggle "Group windows by application" value

keyList.title: Rearrange automatically
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose whether to rearrange Spaces automatically.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do reorder Spaces based on most recent use

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "mru-spaces" -bool "true" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Keep the Spaces arrangement

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dock "mru-spaces" -bool "false" && killall Dock
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Dock settings from macOS UI
2. Toggle "Automatically rearrange Spaces based on most recent use" value

keyList.title: Displays have separate Spaces
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Set up separate spaces for each display (if you use Spaces and have multiple displays).

⚠️ Requires a logout to take effect.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Spaces span all displays.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.spaces "spans-displays" -bool "true" && killall SystemUIServer
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Displays have separate Spaces.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.spaces "spans-displays" -bool "false" && killall SystemUIServer
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Dock settings from macOS UI
2. Toggle "Displays have separate Spaces" value

domainList.title: Mouse
domainList.descriptionMarkdown: The hardware device to control the cursor.

keyList.title: Focus Follows Mouse
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Focus of the Terminal windows when the mouse cursor hovers over them.
The focus change only works between the Terminal windows.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown: By default, to switch between Terminal windows you should click on it or press on cmd + \`. ```bash defaults write com.apple.Terminal "FocusFollowsMouse" -bool "false" && killall Terminal ```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Focus follows the mouse cursor to any Terminal windows.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.Terminal "FocusFollowsMouse" -bool "true" && killall Terminal
```

keyList.title: Acceleration
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Enable or disable mouse acceleration.

By default, macOS has mouse acceleration enabled, which causes the cursor to move less when you slowly move the mouse, and much more when you move the mouse faster.

The underlying acceleration curve (which determines how much movement you get at any given mouse speed) is not customizable without third party tools.

⚠️ A restart of your Mac is required to apply these changes.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Requirements
demoList.descriptionMarkdown: This setting was introduced in macOS 14 Sonoma.

demoList.title: Disable mouse acceleration
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Disabling mouse acceleration can be preferable for gaming, because it's more amenable to building muscle-memory.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain com.apple.mouse.linear -bool "true"
```

demoList.title: Enable mouse acceleration (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Turning on mouse acceleration can be preferable if you have limited desk space for mouse movements, and need to cover a large screen area.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain com.apple.mouse.linear -bool "false"
```

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Mouse settings from macOS UI
2. Open the Advanced panel
3. Toggle "Pointer acceleration" value

keyList.title: Speed
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Set movement speed of the mouse cursor.

⚠️ A restart of your Mac is required to apply these changes.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Venura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
  * High Sierra
  * Sierra
  * El Capitan
  * Yosemite
  * Mavericks
  * Mountain Lion
  * Lion
  * Snow Leopard
  * Leopard
* **Parameter type**: float

demoList.title: Set to 1 (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
By default, the mouse movement scale factor is 1x.

```bash
defaults write NSGlobalDomain com.apple.mouse.scaling -float "1"
```

This setting is listed in the Mouse preference pane as the "Tracking speed" slider. Its ticks give the following values:

* `0.0` (which surprisingly, does not mean "no movement")
* `0.125`
* `0.5`
* `0.6875`
* `0.875`
* `1.0`
* `1.5`
* `2.0`
* `2.5`
* `3.0`

This command allows you set a scale factor greater than 3x.

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Mouse settings from macOS UI
2. Slide "Tracking speed" range value

domainList.title: Safari
domainList.descriptionMarkdown:
Safari is the default web browser on macOS.
Some of its features can be customized.

keyList.title: Show full URL
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show full website address.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show full website URL

```bash
defaults write com.apple.Safari "ShowFullURLInSmartSearchField" -bool "true" && killall Safari
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Don't show full website URL

```bash
defaults write com.apple.Safari "ShowFullURLInSmartSearchField" -bool "false" && killall Safari
```

domainList.title: Screenshots
domainList.descriptionMarkdown:
On a Mac, you can take screenshots using:

* `⌘ cmd`+`⇧ shift`+`3` for fullscreen.
* `⌘ cmd`+`⇧ shift`+`4` for a selection. Then use `space` to capture an entire app.
* `⌘ cmd`+`⇧ shift`+`5` to open the Screenshot app.

There are a few keys you can customize.

keyList.title: Disable shadow
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Disable screenshot shadow when capturing an app (`⌘ cmd`+`⇧ shift`+`4` then `space`).

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Add a shadow to screenshots

```bash
defaults write com.apple.screencapture "disable-shadow" -bool "false"
```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Remove the default shadow from screenshots

```bash
defaults write com.apple.screencapture "disable-shadow" -bool "true"
```

keyList.title: Include date
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Include date and time in screenshot filenames.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

keyList.title: Set location
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Set default screenshot location.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: string

keyList.title: Display thumbnail
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose whether to display a thumbnail after taking a screenshot.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Display the thumbnail after taking a screenshot

```bash
defaults write com.apple.screencapture "show-thumbnail" -bool "true"
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do not display the thumbnail

```bash
defaults write com.apple.screencapture "show-thumbnail" -bool "false"
```

keyList.title: Choose screenshot format
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose the screenshots image format.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
  * Catalina
  * Mojave
* **Parameter type**: string
  * png
  * jpg
  * pdf
  * psd
  * gif
  * tga
  * tiff
  * bmp

demoList.title: Set to png (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
The generated image is a png

```bash
defaults write com.apple.screencapture "type" -string "png"
```

demoList.title: Set to jpg
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
The generated image is a jpg

```bash
defaults write com.apple.screencapture "type" -string "jpg"
```

domainList.title: Simulator
domainList.descriptionMarkdown: Installed as part of the Xcode tools, Simulator is a Mac app simulating iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch, or Apple TV environments.

keyList.title: Set screenshot location
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Set default location for Simulator screenshots.

Note that the folder has to exist in the filesystem.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: string

domainList.title: TextEdit
domainList.descriptionMarkdown: TextEdit allows you to open and edit rich text, plain text and HTML documents.

keyList.title: Set default document format
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Set default document format as rich text (.rtf) or plain text (.txt).

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Rich text is enabled.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.TextEdit "RichText" -bool "true" && killall TextEdit
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Rich text is disabled.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.TextEdit "RichText" -bool "false" && killall TextEdit
```

keyList.title: Set smart quotes
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Set if quotation marks should be converted from neutral form to opening/closing variants.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
  * Big Sur
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Quotes will be converted to opening/closing variants.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.TextEdit "SmartQuotes" -bool "true" && killall TextEdit
```

demoList.title: Set to false
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Quotes will remain in the form they are typed.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.TextEdit "SmartQuotes" -bool "false" && killall TextEdit
```

domainList.title: Time Machine
domainList.descriptionMarkdown: The Time Machine feature allows simple, regular backups of your filesystem.

keyList.title: Don't offer new disks for Time Machine backup
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Prevent Time Machine from prompting to use newly connected storage as backup volumes.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
When a new disk is connected, system prompts to ask if you want to use it as a backup volume.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.TimeMachine "DoNotOfferNewDisksForBackup" -bool "false"
```

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
When a new disk is connected, system does not prompt to ask if you want to use it as a backup volume.

```bash
defaults write com.apple.TimeMachine "DoNotOfferNewDisksForBackup" -bool "true"
```

domainList.title: Trackpad
domainList.descriptionMarkdown: The trackpad is hardware to control the cursor that comes on all MacBooks.

keyList.title: Enable dragging without drag lock
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Mutually exclusive with `DragLock` and `TrackpadThreeFingerDrag`.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: bool

keyList.title: Enable dragging with drag lock
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Mutually exclusive with `Dragging` and `TrackpadThreeFingerDrag`.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: bool

keyList.title: Click weight (threshold)
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Choose between Light/Medium/Firm.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Sonoma
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: int
  * 0
  * 1
  * 2

demoList.title: Set value from UI
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
1. Access Trackpad settings from macOS UI
2. Slide "Click" range value

keyList.title: Enable dragging with three finger drag
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Mutually exclusive with `Dragging` and `DragLock`.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Ventura
  * Monterey
* **Parameter type**: bool

domainList.title: Xcode
domainList.descriptionMarkdown: Xcode is an integrated development environment for macOS containing a suite of software development tools developed by Apple for developing software for macOS, iOS, iPadOS, watchOS, and tvOS.

keyList.title: Add Additional Counterpart Suffixes
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Add additional counterpart suffixes that Xcode should consider in the "Related Items > Counterparts" menu.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: array

demoList.title: Add "ViewModel" and "View"
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Add the "ViewModel" and "View" counterpart suffixes (Useful for Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM) architectures).

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dt.Xcode "IDEAdditionalCounterpartSuffixes" -array-add "ViewModel" "View" && killall Xcode
```

demoList.title: Add "Router", "Interactor" and "Builder"
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Add the "Router", "Interactor" and "Builder" counterpart suffixes (Useful for RIB architectures).

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dt.Xcode "IDEAdditionalCounterpartSuffixes" -array-add "Router" "Interactor" "Builder" && killall Xcode
```

keyList.title: Show Build Durations
keyList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show build durations in the Activity Viewer in Xcode's toolbar at the top of the workspace window.

<!-- break lists -->

* **Tested on macOS**:
  * Catalina
* **Parameter type**: bool

demoList.title: Set to true
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Show the build duration in the Xcode's toolbar

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dt.Xcode "ShowBuildOperationDuration" -bool "true" && killall Xcode
```

demoList.title: Set to false (default value)
demoList.descriptionMarkdown:
Do not show the build duration in the Xcode's toolbar

```bash
defaults write com.apple.dt.Xcode "ShowBuildOperationDuration" -bool "false" && killall Xcode
```
